src:
5 Resep dan cara membuat kimchi ala drama Korea
Kimchi ini nggak sekadar enak, tapi juga sehat untuk tubuh.
04 Nov 2019, 16:35 by Nur Luthfiana Hardian
Brilio.net - Merebaknya drama Korea membuat gaya hidup dari negara Ginseng menjadi kian terkenal. Salah satunya adalah soal kuliner orang Korea. Makanan Korea yang kini menjadi santapan populer di Indonesia adalah kimchi. Makanan yang satu ini sering sekali muncul di tengah-tengah adegan drama Korea. Kalau di drama biasanya kimchi dimakan bersama dengan ramen atau mie rebus.
Kimchi sendiri merupakan sejenis acar dari berbagai bahan sayuran. Warnanya merah karena dicampur dengan pasta cabai. Kimchi punya cita rasa yang cukup unik, pencampuran rasa asam, pedas, dan sensasi dingin. Tak mengherankan kalau kimchi ini jadi salah satu ikon kuliner yang populer dari Korea Selatan. Saat ini pun sudah banyak restoran Korea yang menjajakan kimchi di Indonesia.
Kimchi ini nggak sekadar enak, tapi juga sehat untuk tubuh. Nah, daripada kamu harus merogoh kocek dalam, ternyata makanan legendaris ini bisa dibuat sendiri di rumah. Bahan-bahannya juga mudah didapatkan, yang terpenting adalah kesabaran dan ketelatenan agar hasil jadi kimchi sempurna. Sebab kimchi ini dibuat dengan cara fermentasi atau didiamkan terlebih dulu beberapa hari.
Berikut resep dan cara membuat kimchi secara mudah, brilio.net rangkum dari berbagai sumber pada Senin (4/11).

1. Kimchi lobak.



Instagram/@lysa_tangkulung

Bahan:- 1 sdm gula- cabai bubuk secukupnya- 1 buah lobak putih- 2 siung bawang putih- 1/2 sdt garam- 1/2 ruas jahe
Cara membuat:a. Kupas, cuci lalu potong dadu lobak.b. Beri gula dan garam, aduk aduk. Diamkan selama 30 menit, aduk setiap 10 menit.c. Campur lobak dengan cincangan jahe, bawang putih cincang, dan cabai bubuk.d. Diamkan di suhu ruang satu sampai dua hari. Masukkan ke lemari es.

2. Kimchi sawi putih.



Instagram/@deliciousimportfood

Bahan:- 5 sdm garam kasar- 500 gram sawi putih, belah 4, potong-potong- 1 liter air
Bahan sayur:- 40 gram lobak, potong korek api- 20 gram wortel, potong korek api- 40 gram daun bawang, potong 3 cm
Bumbu halus:- 3 siung bawang putih- 1 cm jahe- 2 sdm kecap ikan- 1 buah apel, kupas, buang biji- 1/2 buah bawang bombay- 12 buah cabe merah
Bubur beras:- 2 sdm tepung beras- 100 ml air- 1 sdm gula pasir
Cara membuat:a. Rendam sawi dengan air dan garam kasar, diamkan selama 30-60 menit. Sesekali remas.b. Untuk bubur beras, campur tepung beras, air, dan gula, aduk rata. Masak hingga kental. Sisihkan.c. Cuci sawi 2-3 kali sampai asinnya hilang. Peras dan tiriskan.d. Masukkan sawi, sayuran pelengkap, bumbu halus, dan bubur beras. Aduk rata.e. Masukkan kimchi ke toples. Simpan selama 2-3 hari disuhu ruangan.

3. Kimchi timun.



Instagram/@henisumiyang81

Bahan:- 1 kg baby mentimun- garam secukupnya- 1/2 buah lobak- 50 gram cabai bubuk- 2 sdm gula pasir- 4 siung bawang putih- 4 buah bawang bombai (ukuran kecil)- 2 sdm tepung beras- 4-5 sdm kecap ikan- 1 buah wortel- air secukupnya- 10 buah cabai keriting merah- 5 buah cabai rawit merah
Cara membuat:a. Cuci bersih timun dan potong sesuai selera.b. Rebus air garam. Tuang ke timun yang sudah dopotong, rendam selama 1 jam.c. Haluskan bawang putih, bawang bombai, dan cabai.d. Panaskan 200cc air, masukkan tepung beras lalu aduk rata. Masukkan bawang halus, cabai bubuk, kecap ikan, dan gula pasir. Matikan kompor, tunggu dingin.e. Potong kecil-kecil wortel dan lobak. Campurkan ke bumbu adonan.f. Tiriskan timun, lumuri dengan bumbu tersebut. Masukkan ke wadah kedap udara. Diamkan selama seharian.

4. Kimchi gochujang.



cookpad.com

Bahan:- garam secukupnya- 2 buah wortel- 250 gram sawi putih- 1 sdm gula pasir- 1 buah bawang bombay- 1 sdm kecap asin- 1/2 sdm minyak sayur- 150 gram pasta gojuchang instan
Cara membuat:a. Pisahkan sawi putih satu persatu, cuci bersih.b. Lumuri dengan garam, diamkan selama 2-3 jam sampai layu.c. Potong wortel memanjang seperti korek api.d. Potong bawang bombay tipis-tipis.e. Masukkan pasta gojuchang ke mangkok, tuang kecap asin, minyak sayur, dan gula pasir. Aduk rata, tuang sedikit air panas, aduk rata.f. Bersihkan garam dari sawi menggunakan air.g. Masukkan pasta gojuchang tadi ke potongan wortel dan bawang bombay, remas-remas.h. Campurkan wortel, bawang bombay, dan sawi, remas-remas sampai rata.i. Masukkan ke toples, diamkan selama 2-3 hari. Simpan di lemari es setelah 2-3 hari didiamkan agar kimchi selalu fresh.

5. Kimchi super pedas.



Instagram/@nungnainty

Bahan:- 3 batang wortel, potong korek api- wijen secukupnya- 1 ikat sawi putih- 1 buah lobak, potong korek api- 4 batang daun bawang, potong korek api- 250 gram garam
Bahan pasta cabai:- 750 ml air- 2 sdm bawang putih- 65 gram tepung beras- 1 sdm jahe cincang- 125 gram gula pasir- 300 cabai bubuk- 1/2 buah bawang bombay, iris tipis
Cara membuat:a. Masak air dan tepung beras. Aduk sampai kental. Matikan kompor.b. Beri gula pasir, aduk rata.c. Diamkan sampai dingin, masukkan ke wadah.d. Beri bubuk cabai, jahe, bawang putih, dan bawang bombay. Aduk rata.e. Masukkan daun bawang, lobak, dan wortel. Aduk rata.f. Cuci bersih sawi, lalu potong kotak. Lumuri dengan garam sampai rata.g. Masukkan sawi ke baskom, diamkan selama 4 jam sampai sawi layu.h. Cuci sawi sampai bersih hingga tak ada garam yang tersisa. Tiriskan.i. Campur sawi dengan pasta cabai. Gunakan sarung platik agar tangan tak panas kena cabai.Baluri sawi sampai rata. Campur dengan wijen.j. Masukkan sawi ke wadah, lalu tutup rapat. Biarkan sawi selama dua hari dalam suhu ruangan.
text:
5 Recipes and how to make Korean drama style kimchi
This kimchi is not just delicious, but also healthy for the body.
04 Nov 2019, 16:35 by Nur Luthfiana Hardian
Brilio.net - The rise of Korean drama is making the lifestyle of the Ginseng country become increasingly famous. One of them is a matter of Korean cuisine. Korean food that is now a popular meal in Indonesia is kimchi. This food often appears in the middle of Korean drama scenes. In dramas kimchi is usually eaten with ramen or boiled noodles.
Kimchi itself is a kind of pickle from a variety of vegetable ingredients. The color is red because it is mixed with chili paste. Kimchi has a pretty unique taste, mixing sour, spicy, and cold sensations. Not surprisingly, this kimchi has become one of the popular culinary icons from South Korea. Today there are already many Korean restaurants selling kimchi in Indonesia.
This kimchi is not just delicious, but also healthy for the body. Well, instead of you having to spend money, it turns out that this legendary food can be made at home. The ingredients are also easy to get, the most important thing is patience and patience so that the results become perfect kimchi. Because kimchi is made by fermentation or allowed to stand for a few days.
The following recipe and how to make kimchi easily, brilio.net summarized from various sources on Monday (4/11).

1. Radish kimchi.



Instagram / @ lysa_tangkulung

Ingredients: - 1 tbsp sugar - chili powder to taste - 1 white radish - 2 cloves of garlic - 1/2 tsp salt - 1/2 ginger segment
How to make: a. Peel, wash then diced radish.b. Give sugar and salt, stir well. Let stand for 30 minutes, stirring every 10 minutes. C. Mix radish with chopped ginger, chopped garlic, and chili powder.d. Let stand at room temperature for one to two days. Put it in the fridge.

2. Chinese cabbage kimchi.



Instagram / @ deliciousimportfood

Ingredients: - 5 tablespoons of coarse salt - 500 grams of chicory, divide 4, cut into pieces - 1 liter of water
Vegetable ingredients: - 40 grams of turnips, cut a match - 20 grams of carrots, cut a match - 40 grams of leeks, cut 3 cm
Fine spices: - 3 cloves of garlic - 1 cm of ginger - 2 tablespoons of fish sauce - 1 apple, peeled, seeded - 1/2 fruit onion - 12 red chilies
Rice porridge: - 2 tablespoons rice flour - 100 ml water - 1 tablespoon granulated sugar
How to make: a. Soak mustard greens with water and coarse salt, let stand for 30-60 minutes. Occasionally squeeze.b. For rice porridge, mix rice flour, water and sugar, stir well. Cook until thick. Set aside.c. Wash the mustard greens 2-3 times until the saltiness is gone. Squeeze and drain.d. Add mustard greens, complementary vegetables, spices, and rice porridge. Stir well.e. Add kimchi to the jar. Store for 2-3 days at room temperature.

3. Cucumber Kimchi.



Instagram / @ henisumiyang81

Ingredients: - 1 kg baby cucumber - salt to taste - 1/2 radish fruit - 50 grams of chili powder - 2 tablespoons granulated sugar - 4 cloves of garlic - 4 pieces of onion (small size) - 2 tablespoons of rice flour - 4-5 tablespoons fish sauce - 1 carrot - enough water - 10 red curly chili - 5 red cayenne
How to make: a. Wash cucumber clean and cut according to taste. Boil salt water. Pour into cucumber that has been cut, soak for 1 hour.c. Puree garlic, onion, and chili.d. Heat 200cc water, add rice flour and stir well. Add the onion, chili powder, fish sauce, and sugar. Turn off the stove, wait for it to cool. Cut carrots and radishes into small pieces. Mix into the batter.f. Drain the cucumber, coat it with the seasoning. Put it in an airtight container. Let stand for the whole day.

4. Kimchi gochujang.



cookpad.com

Ingredients: - salt to taste - 2 carrots - 250 grams of chicory - 1 tablespoon sugar - 1 onion - 1 tablespoon soy sauce - 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil - 150 grams of instant gojuchang paste
How to make: a. Separate chicory one by one, wash clean.b. Sprinkle with salt, let stand for 2-3 hours until withered.c. Cut the carrot lengthwise like a match.d. Cut the onion thinly. E. Add the gojuchang paste to the bowl, pour the soy sauce, vegetable oil, and sugar. Mix well, pour a little hot water, stir well.f. Clean salt from mustard greens using water. Add the gojuchang paste to pieces of carrots and onions, knead it. Mix carrots, onions, and mustard greens, knead until smooth. Put it in the jar, leave it for 2-3 days. Store in the refrigerator after 2-3 days to leave it so the kimchi is always fresh.

5. Super spicy Kimchi.



Instagram / @ nungnainty

Ingredients: - 3 carrot sticks, cut a match - sesame to taste - 1 bunch of mustard greens - 1 turnip, cut a match - 4 scallions, cut a match - 250 grams of salt
Ingredients Chili paste: - 750 ml water - 2 tablespoons garlic - 65 grams of rice flour - 1 tablespoon chopped ginger - 125 grams of granulated sugar - 300 chili powder - 1/2 fruit onions, thinly sliced
How to make: a. Cook water and rice flour. Stir until thick. Turn off the stove. B. Give sugar, stir well.c. Let stand until cool, put in a container.d. Give chili powder, ginger, garlic, and onions. Stir well.e. Add the leeks, turnips and carrots. Stir well.f. Wash the mustard greens, then cut into squares. Sprinkle with salt until blended. Add mustard greens to the basin, let stand for 4 hours until the mustard greens wilt. Wash the mustard greens until there is no salt left. Drain.i. Mix mustard greens with chili paste. Use a plastic sarong so the hands don't get hot with chili. Wrap the mustard greens evenly. Mix with sesame.j. Add the mustard greens to the container, then cover tightly. Leave the mustard greens for two days at room temperature.
